skills.name: PDF Skill
skills.description: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables, creating new PDFs, merging/splitting documents, and handling forms
skills.whenToUse: When you need to fill in a PDF form or programmatically process, generate, or analyze PDF documents at scale

skills.name: Excel/Spreadsheet Skill
skills.description: Comprehensive spreadsheet creation, editing, and analysis with support for formulas, formatting, data analysis, and visualization
skills.whenToUse: When working with spreadsheets (.xlsx, .xlsm, .csv, .tsv) for creating, reading, analyzing data, or modifying while preserving formulas

skills.name: Word Document Skill
skills.description: Comprehensive document creation, editing, and analysis with support for tracked changes, comments, formatting preservation
skills.whenToUse: When working with professional documents (.docx files) for creating, modifying, or working with tracked changes

skills.name: PowerPoint Skill
skills.description: Presentation creation, editing, and analysis for working with presentations (.pptx files)
skills.whenToUse: When creating new presentations, modifying content, working with layouts, or adding speaker notes

skills.name: MCP Builder Skill
skills.description: Guide for creating high-quality MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers that enable LLMs to interact with external services
skills.whenToUse: When building MCP servers to integrate external APIs or services, whether in Python (FastMCP) or Node/TypeScript

skills.name: Skill Creator
skills.description: Guide for creating effective Claude Code skills with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations
skills.whenToUse: When you want to create a new skill or update an existing skill that extends Claude's capabilities

skills.name: Error Debugger Skill
skills.description: Systematic debugging approach for any error with structured error analysis
skills.whenToUse: When encountering errors, bugs, or unexpected behavior in code

skills.name: Logo Builder Skill
skills.description: Interactive logo designer that creates SVG and PNG logos through guided conversation
skills.whenToUse: When the user wants to create a logo, design a brand mark, build an icon, or needs visual identity design

skills.name: Web App Testing Skill
skills.description: Toolkit for interacting with and testing local web applications using Playwright
skills.whenToUse: When verifying frontend functionality, debugging UI behavior, capturing browser screenshots, or viewing browser logs

mcps.name: GitHub MCP
mcps.description: Integration with GitHub for issue tracking, PR creation, code operations, and repository management
mcps.whenToUse: When working with GitHub repositories, issues, pull requests, or code reviews
mcps.installCommand: claude mcp add --transport http github https://github.com/user/mcp-server

mcps.name: PostgreSQL MCP
mcps.description: Direct PostgreSQL database access for queries, schema inspection, and data operations
mcps.whenToUse: When working with PostgreSQL databases for queries, migrations, or data analysis
mcps.installCommand: claude mcp add --transport stdio postgres -- npx @anthropic/mcp-postgres

mcps.name: Filesystem MCP
mcps.description: Enhanced filesystem operations with advanced search, batch operations, and monitoring
mcps.whenToUse: When needing advanced file operations beyond standard Claude Code capabilities
mcps.installCommand: claude mcp add --transport stdio filesystem -- npx @anthropic/mcp-filesystem

mcps.name: Slack MCP
mcps.description: Slack integration for sending messages, reading channels, and managing notifications
mcps.whenToUse: When building Slack integrations or automating team communications
mcps.installCommand: claude mcp add --transport http slack https://your-slack-mcp-server

mcps.name: Stripe MCP
mcps.description: Stripe payment integration for managing customers, subscriptions, and transactions
mcps.whenToUse: When implementing payment processing, subscriptions, or financial operations
mcps.installCommand: claude mcp add --transport http stripe https://your-stripe-mcp-server

mcps.name: MongoDB MCP
mcps.description: MongoDB database access for document operations, queries, and aggregations
mcps.whenToUse: When working with MongoDB databases for CRUD operations or data analysis
mcps.installCommand: claude mcp add --transport stdio mongodb -- npx @anthropic/mcp-mongodb

mcps.name: AWS MCP
mcps.description: AWS services integration for cloud infrastructure management
mcps.whenToUse: When managing AWS resources, deploying infrastructure, or working with AWS services
mcps.installCommand: claude mcp add --transport http aws https://your-aws-mcp-server

hooks.name: Pre-Commit Linting
hooks.description: Automatically run linting before any file write operation
hooks.whenToUse: When you want to enforce code quality standards automatically

hooks.name: Security Audit Hook
hooks.description: Block operations on sensitive files or directories
hooks.whenToUse: When you need to protect sensitive files from accidental modification

hooks.name: Command Logger
hooks.description: Log all bash commands for audit trail
hooks.whenToUse: When you need an audit log of all commands executed

hooks.name: Task Notification
hooks.description: Send notifications when Claude completes major tasks
hooks.whenToUse: When you want to be notified of task completions via Slack, email, etc.

commands.name: /review-pr
commands.description: Review a pull request by number
commands.whenToUse: When you want to quickly review a PR with a single command
commands.fileContent:
---
name: review-pr
description: Review a pull request
argument-hint: <pr-number>
---

Review PR #$1 focusing on:
1. Code quality and best practices
2. Security vulnerabilities
3. Performance implications
4. Test coverage

commands.name: /generate-tests
commands.description: Generate comprehensive tests for a file or component
commands.whenToUse: When you need to quickly generate tests for existing code
commands.fileContent:
---
name: generate-tests
description: Generate tests for a file
argument-hint: <file-path>
---

Analyze @$1 and generate comprehensive tests:
1. Unit tests for all functions
2. Edge cases and error conditions
3. Integration tests if applicable
4. Mock external dependencies

commands.name: /optimize-bundle
commands.description: Analyze and optimize JavaScript bundle size
commands.whenToUse: When your bundle is too large and needs optimization
commands.fileContent:
---
name: optimize-bundle
description: Optimize bundle size
---

Analyze the current bundle:
1. Run bundle analyzer
2. Identify large dependencies
3. Suggest code splitting opportunities
4. Recommend tree-shaking improvements

commands.name: /fix-error
commands.description: Debug and fix a specific error message
commands.whenToUse: When you have an error message and need quick help fixing it
commands.fileContent:
---
name: fix-error
description: Fix an error
argument-hint: <error-message>
---

Analyze this error: $ARGUMENTS

1. Identify the root cause
2. Search codebase for related code
3. Propose a fix with explanation
4. Verify the fix doesn't introduce new issues

commands.name: /document-api
commands.whenToUse: When you need to document REST or GraphQL APIs
commands.fileContent:
---
name: document-api
description: Generate API documentation
argument-hint: <api-file-path>
---

Analyze @$1 and generate documentation:
1. OpenAPI/Swagger specification
2. Endpoint descriptions
3. Request/Response examples
4. Error codes and handling

settings.name: Ask Permissions
settings.description: Configure which tools require explicit permission before use
settings.whenToUse: When you want control over which operations Claude can perform automatically

settings.name: Deny Permissions
settings.description: Block access to sensitive files or directories
settings.whenToUse: When you have files that should never be modified by Claude

settings.name: Filesystem Sandbox
settings.description: Restrict file system access to specific directories
settings.whenToUse: When you want to limit Claude's file access for security

settings.name: Default Model
settings.description: Set the default model for Claude Code sessions
settings.whenToUse: When you want to use a specific model by default

claudemd.name: Project Structure Documentation
claudemd.description: Document your project's file structure and architecture
claudemd.whenToUse: At the start of any project to help Claude understand your codebase
claudemd.templateExample:
# Project Name

## Overview
[Project description]

## Architecture
[Key patterns and decisions]

## Getting Started
```bash
npm install
npm run dev
```

claudemd.name: Coding Conventions
claudemd.description: Document your team's coding standards and conventions
claudemd.whenToUse: When you want Claude to follow specific coding styles
claudemd.installCommand: Add to CLAUDE.md in project root
claudemd.templateExample:
## Code Style

- Use TypeScript strict mode
- Prefer functional components
- Use named exports
- Follow ESLint rules

claudemd.name: Team Workflows
claudemd.whenToUse: When you have specific workflows Claude should follow
claudemd.installCommand: Add to CLAUDE.md in project root
claudemd.templateExample:
## Development Workflow

1. Create feature branch from main
2. Write tests first (TDD)
3. PR requires 2 approvals
4. Squash merge to main
